definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: He did not return to the Empire until four years after Palpatine's defeat.
sentences.chinese: 直到帕爾帕廷殞命四年後，他才重返帝國。
儘管他們不遺餘力救災，但還是有11萬人殞命。

sentences.english: More than 80,000 people were killed and dozens of towns destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 超過8萬人殞命，數十座城鎮被毀。

sentences.english: He was standing next to a guy who got hit by shrapnel and was immediately killed.
sentences.chinese: 他身邊的一個人被樓上掉下的碎片擊中，立時殞命。

definition: to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
